member.summary: Generates a deterministic conflict ID for import conflicts. Uses SHA-256 hash to ensure consistency between preview and execute operations. Format: imp_[12-char-hex]

Document ID involved in conflict
Type of conflict

member.name: M:Embranch.Models.ImportUtility.GenerateCrossCollectionConflictId(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a deterministic conflict ID for cross-collection ID collisions. Uses sorted collection names to ensure same ID regardless of detection order. Format: xc_[12-char-hex]
member.param: First source collection name
Second source collection name
Target collection name
Document ID that collides
member.returns: Deterministic cross-collection conflict ID string

member.name: T:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState
member.summary: PP13-87: Represents the possible states of an Embranch repository infrastructure. Used by RepositoryStatusTool to report clear, actionable state to consumer LLMs.

member.name: F:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState.Ready
member.summary: Repository is fully initialized and operational. All infrastructure (manifest, Dolt repo, Chroma) is present and aligned.

member.name: F:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState.Uninitialized
member.summary: No manifest, no Dolt repo, no Chroma data - completely fresh project. Action: Use DoltClone to clone from a remote, or DoltInit to create a new repository.

member.name: F:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState.ManifestOnly_NeedsDoltBootstrap
member.summary: Manifest exists but Dolt repository is missing - needs bootstrap. Action: Use BootstrapRepository to clone from manifest's remote URL.

member.name: F:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState.ManifestOnly_NeedsChromaBootstrap
member.summary: Manifest and Dolt exist but Chroma database missing - needs bootstrap. Action: Use BootstrapRepository to initialize Chroma and sync from Dolt.

member.name: F:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState.ManifestOnly_NeedsFullBootstrap
member.summary: Manifest exists but both Dolt and Chroma are missing - needs full bootstrap. Action: Use BootstrapRepository to initialize everything from manifest.

member.name: F:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState.PathMisaligned_DoltNested
member.summary: Dolt repository exists but in a nested subdirectory (CLI clone issue). The configured DOLT_REPOSITORY_PATH contains a subdirectory with .dolt instead of .dolt directly. Action: Use BootstrapRepository with fix_path=true or manually reconfigure.

member.name: F:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState.InfrastructureOnly_NeedsManifest
member.summary: Dolt and/or Chroma infrastructure exists but no manifest file. Action: Use InitManifest to create a manifest from current state.

member.name: F:Embranch.Models.RepositoryState.Inconsistent
member.summary: State inconsistency detected that may require manual intervention. Multiple issues detected or configuration conflicts.

Values: auto, prompt, manual, disabled - auto: Automatically sync on startup if manifest differs from local state - prompt: Ask user before syncing on startup (not applicable in MCP context) - manual: Only sync when explicitly requested via tools - disabled: Never auto-sync; use local state only Environment variable: EMBRANCH_INIT_MODE

member.name: M:Embranch.Services.ConflictAnalyzer.IsDoltTableLevelSummary(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the conflict JSON from Dolt is a table-level summary rather than document-level conflicts. Table-level summaries have 'num_data_conflicts' and 'table' fields but NOT 'document_id' or 'collection'. These summaries don't provide document-level granularity needed for proper conflict detection. PP13-72-C2: Also returns true for empty results ({"rows": []}) to ensure fallback is triggered.
member.param: The JSON returned from Dolt's preview merge conflicts
member.returns: True if the JSON is a table-level summary or empty, requiring fallback to three-way diff

Resolution strategy (Ours or Theirs)

member.name: M:Embranch.Services.DoltCli.QueryAsync``1(System.String)
member.summary:
Executes a SQL query and returns the results as typed objects.
IMPORTANT: Use this method for SELECT statements that return row data. For DDL operations (CREATE, DROP, ALTER) use ExecuteAsync() instead. For single-value queries, consider using ExecuteScalarAsync<T>().
This method handles empty responses gracefully and provides guidance when inappropriate SQL statement types are detected.
member.typeparam: The type to deserialize each row into
member.param: SQL SELECT statement
member.returns: Collection of typed objects representing the query results
member.exception: When used with inappropriate SQL statements

member.name: M:Embranch.Services.DoltCli.ExecuteAsync(System.String)
member.summary:
Executes SQL statements that don't return row data (DDL, DML operations).
RECOMMENDED FOR: - DDL operations: CREATE TABLE, DROP TABLE, ALTER TABLE, etc. - DML operations: INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, etc. - Administrative commands: TRUNCATE, GRANT, REVOKE, etc.
RETURNS: Number of affected rows (when available) or 1 for successful DDL operations.
For SELECT statements that return data, use QueryAsync<T>() instead. For single-value SELECT queries, consider ExecuteScalarAsync<T>().
Implementation Note: Dolt CLI doesn't always return affected row counts for DML operations. This method first tries to parse MySQL-style "X rows affected" output, then falls back to heuristic analysis: if the SQL contains INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE and succeeds, assumes 1+ rows affected. This is a conservative estimate to maintain compatibility with standard SQL expectations.
member.param: SQL statement to execute (DDL or DML)
member.returns: Number of affected rows, or 1 for successful DDL operations

member.name: M:Embranch.Services.DoltCli.ExecuteInTransactionAsync(System.String[])
member.summary:
PP13-73-C2: Executes multiple SQL statements within a transaction. Required for conflict resolution during merge operations, as Dolt rejects modifications to dolt_conflicts_* tables when autocommit is enabled.
PP13-73-C3: Added skipCommit parameter. When resolving merge conflicts, COMMIT should be skipped because Dolt blocks COMMIT until ALL conflicts are resolved. The actual commit happens via 'dolt commit' after all conflicts are resolved.
Wraps statements with: SET @@autocommit = 0; [statements] [COMMIT if not skipped]; SET @@autocommit = 1;
RECOMMENDED FOR: - Merge conflict resolution (DELETE/UPDATE on dolt_conflicts_* tables) - Multi-statement operations that must succeed or fail together - Operations during active merge state
member.param: SQL statements to execute within the transaction
member.returns: True if all statements succeeded, false otherwise

member.name: M:Embranch.Services.DoltCli.ExecuteInTransactionAsync(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: PP13-73-C3: Overload with skipCommit parameter for merge conflict resolution. When resolving merge conflicts, COMMIT should be skipped because Dolt blocks COMMIT until ALL conflicts are resolved. The actual commit happens via 'dolt commit'.

member.name: M:Embranch.Services.DoltCli.ExecuteScalarAsync``1(System.String)
member.summary:
Executes a SQL query that returns a single scalar value.
RECOMMENDED FOR: - Aggregate functions: COUNT(*), MAX(id), MIN(date), SUM(amount), AVG(score) - Single-value queries: SELECT active_branch(), SELECT DOLT_HASHOF('HEAD') - Existence checks: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM table WHERE condition - Queries with LIMIT 1 that return a single value
For queries returning multiple rows, use QueryAsync<T>() instead. For DDL/DML statements, use ExecuteAsync() instead.
member.typeparam: The type of the scalar value to return
member.param: SQL SELECT statement that returns a single value
member.returns: The scalar value from the first column of the first row

member.name: T:Embranch.Utilities.JsonUtility
member.summary: Utility methods for JSON handling, particularly for Dolt query result parsing.
member.remarks:
Dolt returns JSON-type columns as embedded JSON structures (objects/arrays), not as escaped strings. This causes issues when using GetString() on JsonElements that have ValueKind = Object or Array.
This utility provides safe extraction methods that handle all JsonValueKind types, returning appropriate string representations for each.
Example problem: SELECT metadata FROM collections WHERE metadata IS NOT NULL Returns: {"key": "value"} as a JsonElement with ValueKind.Object Calling GetString() throws InvalidOperationException
Solution: Use GetElementAsString() which calls GetRawText() for Object/Array types

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.JsonUtility.GetElementAsString(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,System.String)
member.summary: Safely extracts a string representation from a JsonElement. Handles JSON columns from Dolt which may return as nested objects rather than strings.
member.param: The JsonElement to extract a value from
Default value if element is null/undefined
member.returns: String representation of the element's value

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.JsonUtility.GetPropertyAsString(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Safely extracts a string from a JsonElement property. Returns defaultValue if the property doesn't exist or is null/undefined.
member.param: The parent JsonElement containing the property
Name of the property to extract
Default value if property is missing or null
member.returns: String representation of the property value

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.JsonUtility.GetPropertyAsNullableString(System.Text.Json.JsonElement,System.String)
member.summary: Safely extracts a nullable string from a JsonElement property. Returns null if property doesn't exist, is null, or is undefined.
member.param: The parent JsonElement containing the property
Name of the property to extract
member.returns: String representation of the property value, or null

member.name: T:Embranch.Utilities.SqlEscapeUtility
member.summary: Provides methods for safely escaping strings for SQL embedding.
member.remarks:
This utility is essential when building SQL queries with string interpolation. While parameterized queries would be ideal, Dolt CLI has limited support for them.
JSON Escaping Context: When JSON is embedded in a SQL string literal, backslashes need double-escaping. The SQL parser consumes one level of escaping, then the JSON parser needs the rest.
Example: Original: {"path":"C:\Users"} After JsonSerializer: {"path":"C:\\Users"} After EscapeJsonForSql: {"path":"C:\\\\Users"} In SQL: '{"path":"C:\\\\Users"}' After SQL parsing: {"path":"C:\\Users"} -- JSON parser sees valid escape SUCCESS: \\ becomes single backslash
Without proper escaping: After SQL parsing: {"path":"C:\Users"} -- This is what JSON parser sees ERROR: \U is not a valid JSON escape sequence!

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.SqlEscapeUtility.EscapeJsonForSql(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes a JSON string for embedding in a SQL string literal. This is necessary because JSON strings are first parsed by SQL, then by the JSON parser. Backslashes need to be double-escaped.
member.param: The JSON string from JsonSerializer.Serialize()
member.returns: SQL-safe JSON string suitable for embedding in '...'

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.SqlEscapeUtility.EscapeStringForSql(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes a plain string value for use in SQL string literals. Only escapes single quotes (not backslashes). Use this for non-JSON string values like content, titles, etc.
member.param: The string value to escape
member.returns: SQL-safe string with single quotes doubled

member.name: T:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher
member.summary: Utility class for wildcard pattern matching. Supports patterns with '*' wildcards for matching collection and document names.

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher.IsMatch(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a value matches a wildcard pattern. Supports '*' as a wildcard that matches zero or more characters.
member.param: The pattern to match against (may contain '*' wildcards)
The value to test
member.returns: True if the value matches the pattern
member.example: IsMatch("*_summary", "doc_summary") => true IsMatch("doc_*", "doc_123") => true IsMatch("project_*_docs", "project_alpha_docs") => true IsMatch("exact_match", "exact_match") => true IsMatch("exact_match", "other_value") => false

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher.HasWildcard(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a pattern contains wildcard characters.
member.param: The pattern to check
member.returns: True if the pattern contains '*'

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher.FilterByPattern(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Filters a collection of values by a wildcard pattern. Returns all values that match the pattern.
member.param: The pattern to match against
The values to filter
member.returns: Enumerable of values that match the pattern

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher.FilterByPatterns(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Filters a collection of values by multiple wildcard patterns. Returns all values that match any of the patterns.
member.param: The patterns to match against
The values to filter
member.returns: Enumerable of values that match any pattern

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher.GetMatches(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Gets all matching values for a pattern from a collection. Returns a list of all values that match the pattern.
member.param: The pattern to match against
The values to search
member.returns: List of matching values

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher.AnyMatch(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Checks if any value in a collection matches the pattern.
member.param: The pattern to match against
The values to check
member.returns: True if at least one value matches

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher.WildcardToRegex(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a wildcard pattern to a regex pattern. Escapes all regex special characters except '*' which is converted to '.*'.

member.returns: Regex pattern string

member.name: M:Embranch.Utilities.WildcardMatcher.IsValidPattern(System.String)
